description: Relief shown in soundings. "Issued in August 1879, C.P. Patterson, Superintendent." "Aids to Navigation and Jetty Channel corrected to August, 1879." Map has been sectioned in 2 parts and mounted on cloth. Annoatated in pencil at bottom right margin: [from papers of Benjamin Harrison]. Includes text, abbreviations chart listings, and list to light houses. LC copy imperfect: stained along with slight losses along folded lines. description: Title provided by cataloger. Pen-and-ink on paper. Mounted on cloth. Shows the route of a proposed railroad, roads, streams, property lines, and the names of property owners. The proposed railroad starts in Lakeville, Ohio and heads south. The proposed route branches off the "Pittsburgh, Ft. Wayne & Chicago Ry" line in Lakeville. Relief shown by hachures and spot heights. Oriented with north toward the left. At right side, possible attribution note that is only partially legible: Wyndham [illegible] Jones. [Illegible]. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. Gift; Mrs. William D. Wrighton; April 1962. vcFY24

medium: 1 manuscript map : color ; on sheet 46 x 155 cm
notes: Title provided by cataloger.
Pen-and-ink on paper. Mounted on cloth.

Shows the route of a proposed railroad, roads, streams, property lines, and the names of property owners. The proposed railroad starts in Lakeville, Ohio and heads south. The proposed route branches off the "Pittsburgh, Ft. Wayne & Chicago Ry" line in Lakeville.

Oriented with north toward the left.
At right side, possible attribution note that is only partially legible: Wyndham [illegible] Jones. [Illegible].

description: Shows townships, towns, Marietta and Cincinnati Railroad lines, roads, and post offices in Jackson County, Ohio. Pen-and-ink and watercolor on paper. Names of post offices are pasted onto the map. Some roads and railroads highlighted in yellow watercolor. Includes pencil and red ink annotations of town names in a different hand. description: Includes index to points of interest and statistical information. Beneath title: Surveyors Office Cincinnati August 8th 1831. At the request of Capt. H.L. Barnum I have inspected a survey of the city of Cincinnati made by him, I consider the same as correct, as circumstances with the rapid growth and changes of the place will permit. [Signed] Joseph Gist, City Surveyor. I have examined the above survey, and concur in the foregoing statement. [Signed] Elisha Hotchkiss, Mayor. Beneath lower border: Entered according to Act of Congress the 20th day of Dec. 1830 by Robinson & Fairbank of the district of Ohio. LC copy: five wards colored separately in green, yellow, blue, and red. Mounted on cloth. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. vcFY24

notes: Includes index to points of interest and statistical information.

[Signed] Joseph Gist, City Surveyor. I have examined the above survey, and concur in the foregoing statement. [Signed] Elisha Hotchkiss, Mayor.
Beneath lower border: Entered according to Act of Congress the 20th day of Dec. 1830 by Robinson & Fairbank of the district of Ohio.

description: Pen-and-ink and watercolor on paper. Printed label affixed to verso: B. F. Conway, Attorney at Law, Portsmouth, O. Recto has 4 embossed stamps with "Notarial seal - Scioto County Ohio" on outer rim, and a seal of Ohio and "B. F. Conway" inside. Sectioned into 12 panels and mounted on cloth. Includes pencil annotations. Cover removed. Available also through the Library of Congress Web site as a raster image. vcFY24
